content:
Fingering weight yarn and a US 4 (3.5mm) needle will be a great combination for a lace shawl. You'll get a beautiful, delicate fabric with excellent stitch definition.

I'm thrilled to hear that you're happy with your hand-dyed yarn! Turmeric is such a unique and interesting natural dye, and I'm sure the color you achieved is stunning. The warm, golden tone of turmeric will add a lovely depth and richness to your lace shawl.

When you start swatching, pay attention to how the turmeric color interacts with the lace pattern. You might be surprised by how the color pools or highlights certain stitches. It's not uncommon for natural dyes to have subtle variations in tone, which can add to the character of the finished project.

As you work on your shawl, you might also consider adding some subtle texture or interest to the design to complement the turmeric color. For example, you could add some gentle beads or subtle cable patterns to enhance the fabric's texture and visual appeal.

Remember to take your time, enjoy the process, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or need guidance. I'm always here to help.

Good luck with your swatching, and I hope you'll share your progress with me!
